NAME: O'Briens Body
FIRST TEXT: Jesus, this is Hugh O’Brien. What happened here?
FOLLOW UP TEXT: How did he die?|Maybe the knife he’s holding made these cuts.|Maybe the missing axe made these cuts.

NAME: Knife in Hugh’s hand
FIRST TEXT: A knife from the kitchen. Was this used on O’Brien?
FOLLOW UP TEXT: Was it meant for himself, or someone else?|Was he trying to kill Kelly?

NAME: Empty axe holder
FIRST TEXT: This usually holds the axe. I wonder where it is?
FOLLOW UP TEXT: The axe is missing.

NAME: O'Brien's Injuries
FIRST TEXT: Looks like a deep cut.
FOLLOW UP TEXT: He looks to have been cut by a heavy, sharp object.

NAME: Keeper's Logbook
FIRST TEXT: This must be the keeper's logbook. Should I read it?
FOLLOW UP TEXT: The keeper’s logbook. Should I read it?

NAME: Moore's Journal
FIRST TEXT: Probably Jack Moore’s personal journal. Should I read it?
FOLLOW UP TEXT: Jack Moore’s personal journal. Should I read it?

NAME: Crushed plants
FIRST TEXT: Looks like something heavy fell on these plants.|Is this connected to the broken window?
FOLLOW UP TEXT: These plants are crushed, probably under the weight of something heavy.|Did someone hop out of O'Brien's broken window?

NAME: Broken Window
FIRST TEXT: The window is broken.|Did someone hop out of O’Brien’s room through here?
FOLLOW UP TEXT: A broken window. I'll probably have to report it.|Did someone hop out of O’Brien’s room through here?

NAME: Beach Indent
FIRST TEXT: Looks like a small boat landed here.|Was this where the third man landed?
FOLLOW UP TEXT: A small boat must have landed here. I wonder where it is now?|Was the boat taken to leave the island?

NAME: Missing Food
FIRST TEXT: There was supposed to be enough food for two months. How is it all gone?
FOLLOW UP TEXT: How did two men go through all the food?

NAME: Bloodstains
FIRST TEXT: What happened here?|Is all of this from O'Brien?
FOLLOW UP TEXT: There's a lot of blood.|Probably from O'Brien.|Is some of this from Kelly?

NAME: Extra Bedding
FIRST TEXT: A strange place to store extra bedding.
FOLLOW UP TEXT: Did one of the men sleep out here?

NAME: Keeper's Logbook
FIRST TEXT: The keeper’s logbook. Should I read it?
FOLLOW UP TEXT: The keeper’s logbook. Should I read it?

NAME: Medical Supplies
FIRST TEXT: Someone must have gotten hurt. I wonder why they left it out?
FOLLOW UP TEXT: O’Brien probably didn’t use this.

NAME: Bible
FIRST TEXT: O’Brien was a devoted believer.
FOLLOW UP TEXT: O’Brien was a devoted believer.

NAME: Empty Knife Holder
FIRST TEXT: Looks like a knife is missing.|The knife in Hugh's room must be the one missing from here.
FOLLOW UP TEXT: A knife is missing.|The missing knife is in Hugh’s room.

NAME: O'Brien's Keys
FIRST TEXT: O’Brien’s key set. Did he lock himself inside here?
FOLLOW UP TEXT: Did O'Brien lock himself inside? Why? |Why would they leave the keys inside?

NAME: Jack’s room key
FIRST TEXT: A key. It probably fits to a lock somewhere around here.
FOLLOW UP TEXT: A key. It probably fits to a lock somewhere around here.

NAME: Moore's bed
FIRST TEXT: Moore’s bed. It looks almost broken, the way it’s sagging.| Was Moore really the only one to do this damage?
FOLLOW UP TEXT: Could one man sleeping cause the bed to sag this way?

NAME: Whittle
FIRST TEXT: Someone left a whittle here.|Maybe this belonged to the third man staying here.
FOLLOW UP TEXT: O'Brien and Moore were known to have heavy hands. | Was this left behind by someone else?

NAME: Lighthouse note
FIRST TEXT: A series of numbers.|The code to the safe.
FOLLOW UP TEXT: Is this a code to something?|The code to the safe.

NAME: Jack's Room Door
FIRST TEXT: This door is locked.
FOLLOW UP TEXT: Door

NAME: Washbasin
FIRST TEXT: A washbasin. It looks like there's blood in it.
FOLLOW UP TEXT: Why would there be blood in here? Who was washing up?

NAME: Coatrack
FIRST TEXT: A coatrack with one coat on it.|Must be O'Brien's coat.
FOLLOW UP TEXT: Someone left his coat behind.|Probably O'Brien's coat.

NAME: Crate
FIRST TEXT: A crate with spare glass for the lighthouse.
FOLLOW UP TEXT: A crate with spare glass for the lighthouse.

FIRST TEXT: Some chopped wood, usually used for the oven.
FOLLOW UP TEXT: A pile of chopped wood.
